metadata.title: RA and FSP Curriculum: I-002A Fundamentals of FSP (Non-Trustzone)

sections.content:
This introductory curriculum course is a hands-on lab that introduces you to the basics of using the FSP tool flow to develop with the RA MCU Family. This is a helpful pre-requisite to the follow-on Introduction to FreeRTOS and Azure RTOS ThreadX hands-on lab courses.
  I-002A Fundamentals of FSP Presentation and Lab (Non-TrustZone) for FSP 5.5.0 with EK-RA8D1- a step-by-step hands-on lab using FSP 5.5.0 and the EK-RA8D1 kit. It introduces FSP including components, sources, example projects and documentation. The labs section provides a hands-on introduction to using the FSP configurator, each of the configuration tabs, adding modules, building, and debugging. This version is for Non-TrustZone projects.   
  All the lab materials are available in a single zip file located here.
  I-002A Fundamentals of FSP Presentation and Lab (Non-TrustZone) for FSP 5.4.0 with FPB-RA0E1- a step-by-step PPT hands-on lab using FSP 5.4.0 and the FPB-RA0E1 kit. It introduces FSP including components, sources, example projects and documentation. The labs section provides a hands-on introduction to using the FSP configurator, each of the configuration tabs, adding modules, building, and debugging. This version is for Non-TrustZone projects.   
  All the lab materials are available in a single zip file located here.
  I-002A Fundamentals of FSP Presentation and Lab (Non-TrustZone) for FSP 5.2.0 with EK-RA8M1- a step by step PPT hands-on lab using FSP 5.2.0 and the EK-RA8M1 kit. It introduces FSP including components, RTOS, Middleware, sources, example projects and documentation. The labs section provides a hands-on introduction to using the FSP configurator, each of the configuration tabs, adding modules, building, and debugging. This version is for Non-TrustZone projects.  
  All the lab materials are available in a single zip file located here.
